combination.intro: While you were in the mines of
combination.body: your machinery left behind a lot of oil staines on the floor, and the Humans living on that island were quickly aware that you had been there.
combination.extra: They want to know how your machinery works, and how they can use it to drive away the Nomads.

one.button: Invite them into your castle to show them how it works.

ally.text: The humans take notes on how to build the precious machinery.

neutral.text: They are happy to learn your methods and have a peace offering.

enemy.text: The humans were not really expecting your cooperation, and agrees to spare your crew.

two.button: Tell them that you don't support wars, and that you can't tell them.

ally.text: They understand your views, and one of the humans offer a crystal piece in hopes that you will change your mind.

neutral.text: They seem mildly dissappointed, but one of them agrees with you and offers himself to join your cause.

enemy.text: They weren't expecting you to cooperate, so they use brute force and take out one of your crew.

combination.intro: Your machinery left behind large tracks all over the floor in the factory of
combination.body: . And the humans that used to run that factory have taken notice of your visit.
combination.extra: They want to learn about your machines and get the blueprints so they can make their own machinery and take the land of the Highbournes.

one.button: Give them the blueprints and a tutorial on how to make them.

ally.text: They appreciate your help and give you a gift in return for your help.

neutral.text: The humans cheer. They were getting desperate.

enemy.text: They are stunned that you would actually share this information with them.

two.button: Tell them to make their own machines and back off your intellectual property.

ally.text: They are mildly insulted, but understands your point.

neutral.text: The humans were not really expecting you to help out, but they leave you a peace offering.

enemy.text: They expected you to decline, and were prepared for this outcome. They start hacking on your castle.

combination.intro: Down in the vast forests of
combination.body: , your cleric set up protective wards all over the place, and the Highbournes living there have walked straight into them and are aware of your visit.
combination.extra: They want you to tell them how to remove it, as it can cause Nomads to come wandering in.

one.button: Give them the counter measures for the wards.

ally.text: You have redeemed your previous mistake, and they bow their heads at you.

neutral.text: They thank you for your cooperation and put forward an herb you have never seen before.

enemy.text: They turn around, arrogantly, and walks away.

two.button: Tell them that you can not remove them, and that they are forever.

ally.text: They are upset at this and decide to cast a spell of sickness on one of your crew.

neutral.text: They seem displeased, but they accept the reality anyways.

enemy.text: The Highbourne leader looks at one of your crew with fiery eyes, and the crew falls down lifeless.

combination.intro: Your cleric made a holy chant when you were at the magic site of
combination.body: , and some Highbournes heard it and have followed you ever since.
combination.extra: They feel that your holy chanting was blasphemous to their beliefs and they want you to apologize, like the humans never did.

one.button: Apologize politely and say that it will never happen again.

ally.text: They know you by reputation and they forgive you...this time.

neutral.text: Highbournes need more than excuses. You did not manage to convince them.

enemy.text: They leave without a word. You have no idea what they are thinking.

two.button: Refuse to apologize and explain that you have the right to your own beliefs.

ally.text: The highbournes respect your right to believe in what you want. But they want to send one of them to follow you and observe the righteousness of your actions.

neutral.text: They seem impressed by your rightful mind. You might have ganed their respect.

enemy.text: Your castle starts crumbling as their chief raises his arms. He is using his magical powers to punish you.

combination.intro: During the exploration of the wreckage on
combination.body: , the nomads have seen your alchemist preparing some potions.
combination.extra: Their people has recently suffered a disease caused by the Highbournes, and alchemic knowledge might prove useful to them.

one.button: Teach them how to create basic potions to help them face epidemics efficiently.

ally.text: You have helped them more than you can imagine today. They decide to repay you with what little they have.

neutral.text: They are pleased by your choice, and they will remember it.

enemy.text: Your reaction is unexpected. They will remember the help you gave them today.

two.button: Apologize and explain that you need the alchemy potions to yourself in case your crew gets diseases of their own.

ally.text: Your decline is making them very upset. You decide to leave as the situation is becoming dangerous.

neutral.text: They understand your choice but seem disapointed as you leave them to their doom.

enemy.text: Your reputation preceded you and they your decline was expected. They seem to be ready for anything to get what they want.

combination.intro: After you left the village on the island of
combination.body: the nomads have seen you making use of your alchemic powers.
combination.extra: The village you visited has recently been salvaged by a local group of human bandits. The nomads are asking for revenge and your alchemic skills have impressed them.

one.button: Show them how to make your impressive potions and send them on their way.

ally.text: They observe you and leave to prepare their revenge.

neutral.text: They observe you and leave to prepare their revenge.

enemy.text: Pain has driven them mad, they attack you to salvage your castle. Your crew fights them back and you quickly leave.

two.button: Explain to them that revenge is probably not the solution and decline their demand.

ally.text: They are impressed by your peaceful methods. One of them would like to join your crew.

neutral.text: Peaceful thoughts will not ease their craving for revenge. They will remember that.

enemy.text: They are too tired to be upset. You hope that avoiding violence was the best way to help them.
